channel.title: Websites on Your Website Name
channel.description: Recent content in Websites on Your Website Name

item.title: A Static Website Generator Example: Hugo
item.description: The last section should have given you a good idea of what a static website generator is. In fact, the directory structure and page creation methods we looked at were that of Hugo.

item.title: Add your content to the website
item.description: At this stage you are ready to start running your website on your own. We will in this last section look at some more things that you may want to know - how to modify single page settings, gotchas with respect to git

item.title: Assembling a website: Putting it all together
item.description: From the perspective of the static generator there are the following stages in assembling a website. Stage 1: Load Site level configuration Load all the site level configuration defaults from the template Load all the site level configuration specified as markup (json, yaml or toml) that are input by the user overriding template defaults if necessary This is done through standard markup parsers available in the templating engine of the static website generator Stage 2: Create html for each content page in the content directory Load page level configuration by parsing the input markup (json, yaml or toml) Load page level content into memory by parsing the markdown into html.

item.title: Audio Page Parameters
item.description: Below are the additional settings to be specified for Audio pages # 1. The main artist is mentioned under the field "artist". This plays the same role as artist on other pages artist = "Madhav theBard" # 2.

item.title: Books Page Parameters
item.description: Some additional settings need to be specified for books pages # 1. tagline is some small snippet about the book that will come just below the title tagline = "The last book you'll ever need" # 2.

item.title: Buy the domain and setup godaddy
item.description: Ok this section is technically simple, but it’s going to take a while. You need to decide your website name and go buy the domain from godaddy.

item.title: Check site and Upload to github
item.description: So the files are now all with your settings and basic configurations have been changed, it’s a good time to preview the site and then upload to github

item.title: Code-snippets Page Parameters
item.description: Code snippets need a small number of additional settings # 1. Do you use Math in the Code Page. If so, use math=true below. The math display is based on [mathjax](https://www.

item.title: Common Page Parameters
item.description: Our templates contain both the contents as well as configurations for the pages we are creating. Some of the configurations are common across the page types and some are specific to the type of page.

item.title: Config.toml settings
item.description: The config.toml file contains most of the site settings. It is found directly in the main website folder. The following settings need to be changed in the file:

item.title: Connect github and Godaddy: the website goes live
item.description: Now your website is nearly ready to go live. All that remains is connecting github with godaddy. This consists of two parts: Make github pages viewable Change godaddy CNAME to your github Let us look at these in more detail

item.title: Contact Page Settings
item.description: The settings for the contact page http://www.yourdomain.com/contact are contained in the contact.md file which is in the content folder. You can view the sample page in the demo site

item.title: Contact Success Page Settings
item.description: The settings for the contact page http://www.yourdomain.com/contact_success/ are contained in the contact_success.md file which is in the content folder. You can view the sample page in the demo site

item.title: Courses Page Parameters
item.description: Courses, similar to books, have a number of additional optional settings that may be input # 1. The "faculty" for the course is a similar option to author name in the regular pages faculty = "yourName and anotherName" # 2.

item.title: Create an Actors Template
item.description: Let’s say you want to create a new page type called actor. You would want each page to have Name of the actor Date of birth List of movies the actor has acted in A list of best dialogues of actor along with link to view them Profile write up about the actor Representing above variables in page configuration First thing you want to do is to create configuration to hold the variables that we listed above.

item.title: Deciding what to put on your website: My experience
item.description: There are different options available in the _index.md in any content folder. I have already set these based on defaults, so this section is completely optional.

item.title: Deciding what to put on your website: My experience
item.description: My main motivation behind having this website was to have a space on the internet where I could share my work. Facebook and social media were good places to spread the message, but not host thoughts and work.

item.title: Documentation Page Parameters
item.description: Documentation pages (like the one you are reading) contain a number of parameters that make it useful to navigate. Further there is a pageNumber option which is useful for sorting

item.title: Download Git Bash, Hugo and a text editor
item.description: The following are going to be needed for creating your own site: Git Bash Hugo Text Editor Get git bash Go to Git Download Website At the top, you would find a few operating systems.

item.title: Download the template files
item.description: Open a bash/terminal/command prompt create (mkdir) a folder where you want to keep your website files. For example, type mkdir c:\users\yourname\website. Note that you need to use forward slash if working in mac or linux environments.

item.title: Events Page Parameters
item.description: The events pages unlike other pages do not contain many of the common settings. Instead they may contain a few additional (self-explanatory) settings # 1. A short description of the event that goes below the title tagline = "The beats are coming to town" # 2.

item.title: Front Page Settings
item.description: The front page settings are contained in the _index.md file which is in the content folder. It contains most of the settings needed to be changed in the front page.

item.title: Get Github login and setup Github
item.description: As described here, a version control system (or VCS) is a system that records changes to a file or set of files over time so that you can recall specific versions later.

item.title: Git Gotchas
item.description: There are various things that can go wrong when updating git. Because github also hosts our site apart from being a version control system, we have to be doubly careful.

item.title: Implement your own static website with Godaddy and github in 10 easy steps
item.description: The main steps for creating your own website are as follows: Download Git Bash, Hugo and a text editor Setup Github Buy the domain and setup godaddy Download the template files Preview the site Modify Basic Settings Check site and Upload to github Connect github and Godaddy Plan your website Add your own content

item.title: Introduction to Static Sites with Hugo
item.description: This document is aimed at someone who has not built a website before, so if this is too simple, then bear with me, or skim through this section.

item.title: Modify Settings and site configurations
item.description: At this stage, you will want to modify all the settings like the site author name, website name, etc on the site to be your own.

item.title: Modify Templates
item.description: When you are creating new single page templates or list templates, it may be easy to first copy an existing template. These are html files with additional hugo code.

item.title: People Page Parameters
item.description: The people pages have a large number of additional settings over and above the common settings. This is similar to the about section on the front page.

item.title: Plan your website and contents
item.description: Now that you have seen your site scaffold and seen what you can do with it, it is time for you to start planning what you want to launch your website with.

item.title: Popup Success Page Settings
item.description: The settings for the popup success page http://www.yourdomain.com/popup_success/ are contained in the popup_success.md file which is in the content folder. You can view the sample page in the demo site

item.title: Popup Success Page Settings
item.description: The privacy policy is simply a text file stored at privacy.md file which is in the content folder. The privacy policy will be displayed in http://www.

item.title: Presentations Page Parameters
item.description: The presentations pages are mainly about the presentation pdf itself. They may optionally contain some writeup below the presentation. # 1. The tagline goes below the title and is a brief description of the presentation tagline = "An in-depth look at management with a specific view on Marketing" # 2.

item.title: Publications Page Parameters
item.description: The publications pages use a bunch of new parameters including a few categorizations. # 1. We list the authors in these pages with links to their personal pages (which could be outside of the site itself) authors = [ { name = "yourName", url = "/people/person1" }, { name = "Ankit Mathgenius", url = "/people/person2" }, { name = "Sailesh Tripper", url = "/people/person3" } ] # 2.

item.title: Retrieving a Webpage from the internet
item.description: what happens between you typing an address into your browser and the browser displaying the website? This forms the crux of what is the internet, or how something that exists remotely is displayed on your browser.

item.title: Reviews Page Parameters
item.description: The reviews pages mostly contain new configurations regarding the product or item being reviewed # 1. Firstly enter some basic details about the item being reviewed including the name, the maker, and the item link reviewed_item = "Opel Astra Car" reviewed_item_maker = "General Motors" reviewed_item_link = "https://en.

item.title: Setup Google Cloud Storage with Hugo and Godaddy
item.description: Github Pages is easy to use and free. The only problem could be that it is slow in some countries (especially for large sites) compared to Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure or AWS.

item.title: Setup local server and preview the site
item.description: Check whether the website works as is. For this you need to locally create a hugo server. Thankfully, this is as simple as writing a simple command on your terminal/bash.

item.title: Static Website Generators
item.description: In this section we get into the details of how a static website generator works. On one side there is a user (website creator) writing content that they want displayed.

item.title: Static Websites: Implications and Constraints
item.description: In the section Parts of a webpage we mentioned how a site can be made dynamic by adding javascript on the client side. From the last section we understood a site can be statically served or dynamically served on the server side.

item.title: Terms of Service Page
item.description: The privacy policy is simply a text file stored at termsservice.md file which is in the content folder. The terms of service will be displayed at http://www.

item.title: The parts of a regular webpage - HTML, CSS and Javascript
item.description: There are three basic parts to every website as you see it on your browser. The content, the styling and the logic. These are described by three parts, html, css and javascript.

item.title: Thoughts Page Parameters
item.description: These are the only pages where the configurations include styling elements. The thought layout would contain some content placed on a background image # 1. Please change the image used for the background_image.

item.title: Website Templates and the need for them
item.description: When you open a Word document to write something, you just open it and start writing. There is no friction between you thinking a thought and getting it in a computer readable format.

item.title: Workshops Page Parameters
item.description: Workshops pages contain a good number of new configurations apart from the common ones.We may have come across some of these in different Page Types already
